results.title: The Ruling class [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Keep Films, Jules Buck, Jack Hawkins and Peter Medak
results.brief_description: Based on the stage play by Peter Barnes, this screen adaptation of “The Ruling class” (also written by Peter Barnes) remains true to the original farcical and darkly comic tale of British aristocracy. Combining the use of melodrama, musical and horror film genres, Peter Medak has created a totally bizarre visual feast of irony and parody of upper class England revolving around the rather unusual death of a British lord (Harry Andrews) who accidently hangs himself while in military uniform and a ballerina’s tutu. The Earl’s son, Jack Gurney (Peter O’Toole) becomes the 14th Earl of Gurney and finds himself named in the will as heir to the Gurney Estate. Only one problem - Jack is a paranoid schizophrenic who believes he is Jesus Christ. Jack’s disinherited relatives resolve to maintain their pride and their position as an upper class family and plot to have Jack committed to a mental institution and leave them as guardians to the Gurney Estate. However, Jack has to produce a family heir before any of this can take place. The lengths the family go to and the unexpected, hilarious and truly bizarre outcomes of their efforts, including Jack beginning to secretly think that he is Jack the Ripper and murdering one of the family members, add up to a most unusual and enjoyable cinematic experience consisting of narrative and vaudeville song-and-dance sequences, mixed in with a good measure of black comedy and contempt for the British class system. Cast also includes Arthur Lowe, Alastair Sim, Coral Browne, Michael Bryant, William Mervyn, Carolyn Seymour.

results.title: The Rules of the game = La Regle du jeu (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Nouvelle Edition Francaise, Claude Renoir and Jean Renoir
results.brief_description: On its initial release Renoir’s masterwork was greeted with contempt by critics, hostility by audiences and banned by the French government as “subversive” and “demoralising”. This restored version, put together under Renoir’s direction, makes available again one of the most acclaimed films ever made. A group of wealthy aristocratic and bourgeois Parisians holiday at their friend’s country chateau. There, as their amoral relationships turn alternately tragic or absurd, their lives and class are revealed as ultimately empty and decaying. Featuring some of the most beautifully constructed and edited sequences in film, Renoir’s direction - though seemingly understated - manages to convey the richness and complexity of a whole era and class: an era that World War II was to bring to an end. Restored by Jean Gaborit and Jacques Durand with approval and advice from Jean Renoir who dedicated it to the memory of Abdre Bazin. Music by Roger Desormieres; photographed by Sam Levin; wardrobe by Chanel.

results.title: The Roman spring of Mrs. Stone
results.creator_credit: Seven Arts Productions, Jose Quintero and Louis De Rochemont
results.brief_description: Vivien Leigh stars as Karen Stone, a wealthy American actress who settles into a luxurious apartment in Rome after the sudden death of her husband and gradually falls prey to fortune hunters who seek monetary rewards in return for romantic favours. Warren Beatty plays her young lover who feigns amour then flutters away on another attractive assignment. Also stars Lotte Lenya. Adapted from the novel by Tennessee Williams.

results.title: The Rocky Horror picture show (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Michael White and Jim Sharman
results.brief_description: The film begins with our innocent pair of lovers, Brad and Janet, stranded in a rain storm with the only available shelter being the weird Dr. Frank N. Furter mansion. Before the night is out Brad and Janet will lose their respective virginities to the Doctor, be introduced to his muscle-bound creation, Rocky, and battle the evil beings from the planet Transylvania. The plot is ridiculous, the music enjoyable and the whole thing is an outrageously good time. Possibly the most popular cult movie of all time and based on the original stage musical by Richard O’Brien. With Richard O’Brien, Susan Sarandon, Nell Campbell and Patricia Quinn all doing the “Time warp”. Tim Curry steals the show with an over-the-top performance as the sex mad Doctor.

results.title: The Rock
results.creator_credit: Hollywood Pictures, Don Simpson/Jerry Bruckheimer Films, Don Simpson, Jerry Bruckheimer and Michael Bay
results.brief_description: Action thriller set on the island of Alcatraz where 81 tourist hostages are being held by a somewhat unstable Marine Corps general called Francis X. Hummel (Ed Harris). The ransom is $100 million for war reparations to the families of servicemen killed in covert operations and if this is not paid then Hummel and his men will bomb San Francisco with deadly gas. Enter FBI chemical weapons expert Stanley Goodspeed (Nicolas Cage) and former British spy Jack Patrick Mason (Sean Connery) whose assignment is to penetrate Alcatraz and stop Hummel at all cost. Fast-paced and frenetic.

results.title: The Robe
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Frank Ross and Henry Koster
results.brief_description: Rome - 33 A.D., the headstrong tribune Gallio, (Richard Burton), offends the Emperor’s nephew Caligula, (Jaye Robinson), and is banished with his garrison and Greek slave Demetrius, (Victor Mature) to Jerusalem. At the Crucifixion, he wins Christ’s robe, but later as Jesus’s last words echo in his brain, he is driven half mad with fear and guilt. The slave Demetrius, becomes a Christian and takes the robe. The story of how Marcellus regains the robe, sanity and salvation aided by his true love Diana, (Jean Simmons), unfolds in this spectacular epic.

results.title: The Roaring Twenties
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Jack L. Warner and Raoul Walsh
results.brief_description: No other actor played a gangster with the conviction of James Cagney. As Eddie Bartlett, James Cagney epitomises the classic ani-hero - a lawless man in a lawless time. Humphrey Bogart cut his teeth with his rough and tough portrayal of George - Eddie’s closest buddy and partner in crime. The combined talents of these two stars make “The Roaring Twenties” a landmark in cinematic history - the seminal gangster movie. Co-starring Priscilla Lane, Gladys George, Jeffrey Lynn, Frank McHugh and Paul Kelly.

results.title: The River wild
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Turman-Foster Company, David Foster, Lawrence Turman and Curtis Hanson
results.brief_description: Meryl Street is Gail, a former rafting instructor, returning to her old river with her husband and son for her son’s birthday, and to try and salvage what is left of her marriage. On the river they meet Wade (Kevin Bacon) and Terry, two fellow rafters on their way to Bridle Creek. Halfway down the river Gail discovers Wade and Terry abandoned by their guide and offers to lead them the rest of the way. This harmless act puts all their lives in danger as Wade and Terry reveal their true, evil selves. To save her family, Gail must face her own fears and run the Gauntlet - the most dangerous of all the rapids on the river.
